wikipedia_page.main: John Merry le Sage (23 April 1837 – 1 January 1926), was a British journalist and newspaper editor.

response: In 1885, he was appointed chief sub-editor, but a golf accident that caused him to lose his eye led to his transferral to outdoor duty as a reporter for some months. In 1900, he was appointed an assistant to the editor, Sir John le Sage, later becoming his chief assistant. Taking the position of assistant editor in 1914, he went to Paris soon after the outbreak of the First World War to organise the Telegraph's reporting.
* John le Sage (1837–1926), British journalist and newspaper editor
